categories.title: The servant is dependent on his Lord #1

subCategories.subTitle: The servant is dependent on his Lord #1
subCategories.desc: All human beings depend on Allah for their welfare and prevention of evil in various matters of their religion and world. Allah says (interpretation of the meaning): O mankind, you are those in need of Allah, while Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.

subCategories.subTitle: The servant is dependent on his Lord #2
subCategories.desc: Prophet (ﷺ) used to say after every compulsory prayer, The servant will ask his Lord for all of his religiously and worldly needs, because the treasure of all things is in the hands of Allah. Allah says (interpretation of the meaning): “And there is not a thing but that with Us are its depositories, and We do not send it down except according to a known measure.” (Sura Al-Hijr 15:21) No one can withhold what Allah gives; And, no one can give what he resists.
subCategories.arabik: لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيْكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ، اَللَّهُمَّ لَا مَانِعَ لِمَا أَعْطَيْتَ وَلَا مُعْطِيَ لِمَا مَنَعْتَ وَلَا يَنْفَعُ ذَا الْجَدِّ مِنْكَ الْجَدُّ
subCategories.Translation: Translation: There is none worthy of worship except Allah alone with no partner or associate. He is the Dominion and to Him be all praise, and He is able to do all things. O Allah, one can withhold what You have given and none can give what You have withheld, and no wealth or fortune can benefit anyone for from You comes all wealth and fortune.

subCategories.subTitle: The reward of freeing of a slave
subCategories.desc: All human beings depend on Allah for their welfare and prevention of evil in various matters of their religion and world. Allah says (interpretation of the meaning): O mankind, you are those in need of Allah, while Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.
subCategories.arabik: لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ، وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ، وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
subCategories.Translation: None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. His is the dominion and His is the praise, and He is Able to do all things The Prophet (ﷺ) said: The person who says the above statement 10 times It would be as if he had freed four of Ishmael's (As) children from slavery.

categories.title: The most important thing to ask Allah for

subCategories.subTitle: Allah's guidance #4
subCategories.arabik: اَللَّهُمَّ أَعِنِّيْ عَلَى ذِكْرِكَ وَشُكْرِكَ وَحُسْنِ عِبَادَتِكَ
subCategories.Translation: O Allah, help me to remember You, to give You thanks, and to perform Your worship in the best manner.
subCategories.desc: He whom Allah guides is the [rightly] guided, but he whom He leaves astray - never will you find for him a protecting guide. (Surah Al-Kahf 18:17)

subCategories.subTitle: Allah's guidance #2
subCategories.arabik: اِهْدِنِي لِمَا اخْتُلِفَ فِيهِ مِنَ الْحَقِّ بِإِذْنِكَ إِنَّكَ تَهْدِي مَنْ تَشَاءُ إِلَىصِرَاطٍ مُّسْتَقِيْمٍ
subCategories.Translation: Guide me through that which there has been difference concerning the truth, verily, You are upon a straight path.
subCategories.desc: He whom Allah guides is the [rightly] guided, but he whom He leaves astray - never will you find for him a protecting guide. (Surah Al-Kahf 18:17)

subCategories.subTitle: Allah's guidance #2
subCategories.arabik: وَاهْدِنِيْ لِأَحْسَنِ الْأَخْلَاقِ لَا يَهْدِيْ لِأَحْسَنِهَا إِلَّا أَنْتَ وَاصْرِفْ عَنِّي سَيِّئَهَا لَا يَصْرِفُ عَنِّي سَيِّئَهَا إِلَّا أَنْتَ
subCategories.Translation: Guide me to the best of manners for none can guide to the best of them but You. Protect me from bad manners for none can protect against them but You.
subCategories.desc: He whom Allah guides is the [rightly] guided, but he whom He leaves astray - never will you find for him a protecting guide. (Surah Al-Kahf 18:17)

categories.title: Ask for paradise & protection from fire

subCategories.subTitle: Ask for paradise & seek refuge from fire
subCategories.arabik: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ الْجَنَّةَ وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ النَّارِ
subCategories.Translation: O Allah, I ask You for Paradise and seek Your protection from the Fire. Narrated by Abu Huraira (RA): The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), asked a man, What do you supplicate in your prayer? The man says, I recite Tashahhud and say- (The dua is mentioned above) I can’t recite dua as beautifully as you, nor can I recite dua like Mu'adh! Then Prophet (ﷺ) said, “We also supplicate like you!”

subCategories.subTitle: Seeking good of this world and the hereafter
subCategories.arabik: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ الْجَنَّةَ وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ النَّارِ
subCategories.Translation: Al-`Abbas bin `Abdul-Muttalib (RA) said: “I said: ‘O Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), teach me something that I may ask Allah, [Mighty and Sublime] for.’ He (ﷺ) said: ‘Ask Allah for Al-`Āfiyah.’ Then I remained for a day, then I came and said: ‘O Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), teach me something that I may ask Allah for.’ So he (ﷺ) said to me: “O Abbas, O uncle of the Messenger of Allah! Ask Allah for Al-`Āfiyah in the world and in the Hereafter.” [1] Narrated by Abu Bakr Siddiq (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said (sitting) on the pulpit, Seek forgiveness and healing from Allah, for no one has been given anything better than healing after Yaqeen. [2]

categories.title: Excellence of doing Tasbeeh, Tahmid, Tahlil, Takbeer

subCategories.subTitle: The reward of freeing the four slaves of Bani Ismail (AS)
subCategories.arabik: لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ، وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ، وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
subCategories.Translation: None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone, without any partner. To Him belong all sovereignty and praise and He is over all things omnipotent. Whoever says this dua ten times is like one who has freed four slaves from among the children of Ismaa'eel.

subCategories.subTitle: Sins will be forgiven even if like the foam of the sea
subCategories.arabik: لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ، وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ، وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
subCategories.Translation: None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone, without any partner. To Him belong all sovereignty and praise and He is over all things omnipotent. Whoever says this dua ten times is like one who has freed four slaves from among the children of Ismaa'eel.

subCategories.subTitle: A dhikr which is light on tongue, Heavy on the balance
subCategories.arabik: لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ، وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ، وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
subCategories.Translation: None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone, without any partner. To Him belong all sovereignty and praise and He is over all things omnipotent. Whoever says this dua ten times is like one who has freed four slaves from among the children of Ismaa'eel.

subCategories.subTitle: Time when duas are accepted #1
subCategories.arabik: اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَسْأَلُكَ الْجَنَّةَ وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ النَّارِ

Ask Allah for Al-`Āfiyah in the world and in the Hereafter.” [1] Narrated by Abu Bakr Siddiq (RA): The Prophet (ﷺ) said (sitting) on the pulpit, Seek forgiveness and healing from Allah, for no one has been given anything better than healing after Yaqeen. [2]
